includeLayers.name: Indeks Risiko Banjir
includeLayers.description: A flood describes the inundation of land that is normally dry by a large amount of water. For example, a flood can occur after heavy rainfall, when a river overflows its banks. The effect of a flood is for land that is normally dry to become wet.InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015
